Event.name: Progression
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> changes from a <fen>Prior_state</fen> to a <fen>Post_state</fen> in a sequence that follows a pre-defined plan, expectation, or model of change. The change is usually assumed to be an improvement for the <fen>Entity</fen>. Because this frame is describing change according to some known model of the <fen>Entity</fen>, the <fen>Prior_state</fen> and <fen>Post_state</fen> are backgrounded, and often implicit.
<ex><fex name="ent">Their offensive armament</fex> has <t>developed</t> <fex name="pri">from short range missiles</fex> <fex name="pos">to long-range ballistic weaponry</fex> in a relatively short period .</ex> <ex>The <t>maturation</t> <fex name="ent">of warhead technology</fex> is, perhaps, not far off .</ex> <ex><fex name="ent">Recovery in our major overseas markets</fex> has <t>progressed</t> <fex name="man">tentatively</fex> and increased spending by consumers and government does not appear to be benefiting this</ex> <ex><fex name="Explanation">Why</fex> have <fex name="ent">we</fex> <t>developed</t> <fex name="dom">economically</fex> <fex name="man">as we have</fex>?</ex>
This frame is not equivalent to the frame Improvement_or_decline for two reasons. Firstly, Progression implies a smooth or multi-stage change involving several different states of the <fen>Entity</fen> in an expected sequence, while Improvement_or_decline may be simple or complex, in accord with an expected sequence or not. Secondly, progression along an expected sequence does not necessarily mean that things get better (or worse) for the <fen>Entity</fen>. This is clear in the case of progression of a disease, since different ailments have very different expected sequenes, with initial onset leading to expected disappearance (for cases like the cold), or to permanent impairment (in the case of Parkinsons), or to death (in many forms of cancer). However, it is more confusing in the very common case of the progress of a biological <fen>Entity</fen> from birth to death, where this frame often emphasizes the phases of the lifespan where the organism increases in ability, thus reaching a more desirable state. Plans are also spoken of as progressions, and because the expected sequence is towards the goal of the agents that formed the plan, these uses of the progress frame also emphasize improvement. </def-root>

Arg.name: Entity
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The object that undergoes change.
<ex><t>Advances</t> <fex name="ent">in marketing techniques</fex> have since rendered it obsolete.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Prior_state
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The former state of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>I think we have <t>advanced</t> somewhat <fex name="pri">from that way of thinking</fex> .</ex>
</def-root>

Arg.name: Post_state
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The state of the <fen>Entity</fen> following an advance.
<ex>The roads have now <t>advanced</t> <fex name="pos">to a level of perfection not seen since Rome</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the progress occurs.
<ex><fex name="tim">When</fex> did the X-wing <t>progress</t> beyond the drawing board?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Rate
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The rate at which the change happens.
<ex>His captaincy has <fex name="rat">slowly</fex> <t>matured</t> until he has made us forget the sulky Nasser Hussian era</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A description of the progress, generally a description comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>).
<ex>Recovery in our major overseas markets has <t>progressed</t> <fex name="man">tentatively</fex> and increased spending by consumers and government does not appear to be benefiting this .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The period over which the progress occurs.
<ex>Screwcap wine seals enable bottle maturation, and provide ideal conditions for <t>maturation</t> of wines <fex name="dur">over a long period of time</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The amount of advancement that the <fen>Entity</fen> has attained.
<ex>Robert's music is <t>developing</t> <fex name="deg">further</fex> as he hones his live set to bring in the diverse elements of pan-African music.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Domain
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The relevant dimension of development.
<ex>Why have we <t>developed</t> <fex name="dom">economically</fex> as we have? </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An event or state of affairs that brings about the development of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the state of affairs denoted by the target as role fillers in other frames</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Circumstances</fen> describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: progress.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: change towards a more advanced condition

lexUnit.name: progress.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: development towards a better, more complete, or more modern condition.

lexUnit.name: development.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of making progress or being developed

lexUnit.name: mature.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: become more developed, usually implying greater capability or usefulness.

lexUnit.name: maturation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action or process of maturing.

lexUnit.name: stagnate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to stop developing or remain undevoloped.

lexUnit.name: progression.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: sequence of change in accord with normal expectations.
